Reviews.Title: “Poor digs, expensive cost!”
Reviews.Author: pontypaulwales
Reviews.Content: I personaly thought this hotel was a lot of money for what it was. I was given a room that was supposed to be a family room as no single or doubles available, this was tiny, so dread to think what the other rooms were like. No windows in the room, or should I say cell! Breakfast was a farce Also if you parked in the small car park early you would be blocked in and no way of getting out until the owner of the car in front eventually turned up Asking ar reception before 8 in the morning was met with a guy who was sleeping behind the counter and no help when woken up!

Reviews.Title: “Health warning!”
Reviews.Author: clareyyvonne
Reviews.Content: Cheapness is not an excuse not to be clean. One star is too much for this hotel. There was filth everywhere in the room, shower was broken, little to no pressure, tile missing. There was undescribable dirt in the room, skirting board, windows, carpet. Very strong smell of urine on the carpet, hidden by a rug. Discusting!

Reviews.Title: “When are you coming back to give me my keys for the room ?”
Reviews.Author: N_D_Franklin
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel once about 4 years ago . At 1st it was ok . We stay in room number 2 at the bottom floor with a en suite bathroom . The room was old with the owner friend bed bugs . An old TV and a little dark room . As this hotel is close to brent cross and it near the word cheap 60 pound ( but not worth the 60 pound) an emergency happen where we had to stay again .At around 8pm I rang the bell no one answer so I rang again still no answer then a tired old man open the door and shout what do you want . I looked up thinking I was in the wrong place . This man was so RUDE ! I asked if they was any rooms left he said yes and he walked off . I am still waiting for him to come back ! Please you need to close this place down

Reviews.Title: “Took 1 look at room and left”
Reviews.Author: ParkwoodTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for me by a London-based company that I was visiting though I can't imagine why this hotel would be on the list of preferred places for business visitors. Admittedly the travel budget was tight - under 70 pounds per night. I was booked into a double room. The gentleman manning reception was rude, unhelpful, and quite frankly, needed a good wash. The hotel could have done with a good wash too. I left shortly after seeing the room I'd been given because it was grimy and I couldn't imagine spending a night in its cramped confines. Avoid this hotel if you can afford to.

Reviews.Title: “IT IS BEING REFURBISHED AND WAS QUITE COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: janioStLeonardsOnSea
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive to book this hotel but was pleasantly surprised.It is being refurbished and the corridors have new carpet.We had a twin bed room which had been refurbished. The walls had been painted, the carpet was new and the twin beds were super comfy. It was not perfect but i would go again. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “SHOULD BE ADVERTISED WITH A HEALTH WARNING”
Reviews.Author: lizziewollen
Reviews.Content: I am mortified to have booked my husband and sister and I into this filthy hotel. The location suited our needs and for this we were prepared for basic standards. But one could never be prepared for the dirt! It was filthy. The floors were filthy. The paintwork was filthy. The windows were filthy. The ensuites were filthy. As for the smell...a mixture of gas and sewerage. This was definitely our worst experience of accomodation in fifty years. Advertising should carry a health warning

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at this "hotel" - avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Carol1265
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with family and we could not believe that this "hotel" had been allowed to open. We arrived to a building which looked terrible on the outside with a broken stair rail to the door. Then were greeted with a caged reception desk - it should have said it all!! One of the rooms had a door to the shower room which was hanging off and you had to be quick or the shower base would fill up and flood the floor. As for the smell - there are no words to describe it - a sewage smell was the closest we can get. The "penthouse" on the top floor was even worse. We could not bring ourselves to walk on the carpet it was that dirty and kept shoes/slippers on our feet at all times. The wallpaper was flithly and hanging off. The window was so dirty you could not see out of it and the handle to open and close the window was handing off, the second night it did break and we had to sleep with the window open. The shower/toilet was really small and again the wallpaper was hanging off. The toilet handle was hight above your head was again broken. The smell again was seeping under the door and we tried to spray perfume on the pillows at night to cover the continual smell. There were continuous banging of doors throughtout the night and we really got very little sleep over the 2 nights. I would never suggest to anyone to stay there ever - not unless dramatic changes were made.

Reviews.Title: “Just an awful palce top stay”
Reviews.Author: johnsmithbristol
Reviews.Content: From the arrival to a "caged" reception area, to the inadequate 4' bed for two people, the cold shower room, with a broken w.c and a broken cystern handle, just one dull light, the filthy carpet, the night time fight/argument which continued twice for periods of around 45 minute during the night, (and we did not go to bed until 2.30 am) the whole experience reminded us of the "Bates Motel" but worse from Psycho. A truly awful experience. The small car park was full too, My tip is to avoid this awful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - Staff robbed our room”
Reviews.Author: DeBigDog
Reviews.Content: AVOID THIS HOTEL LIKE THE PLAGUE. IT IS OLD, DIRTY, SMELLY, RUN DOWN AND THE STAFF ARE THIEVES. My self and my partner stayed in this hotel because it convenient location when we for flat hunting in the area. We found the hotel to be of low standard but were not alarmed as it was CHEAP and suited our budget. However, returning to the hotel after our first days flat hunting we discovered that while our room had been tidied - a spare mobile phone and charger of mine along with my girlfriends purse with drivers license, an old bank cards, sim cards and travel doc's had gone missing from our bags left in the room!! My girlfriends bank later called her to say that the bank card had been tried with wrong PIN twice and the thieves then had the check to call her bank and demand the pin number from them using details from the stolen drivers license!! We confronted the cleaners (also breakfast cooks) the following morning and they flatly denied any wrong doing - with no proof but the fact that our belongings were gone we quietly awaited the end of our stay. AVOID THIS HOTEL LIKE THE PLAGUE. IT IS OLD, DIRTY, SMELLY, RUN DOWN AND THE STAFF ARE THIEVES.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a chance”
Reviews.Author: northy1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Cricklewood Hotel. It was pretty poor from the parking point of view with a very small car park for a thirty roomed hotel. On arrival the reception were very helpful, keys handed over and asked if we needed anything. The room was very basic and the cleaning was still being done even though we did tell them what time we would be arriving. The only downside to the room is that they are not en-suite and we had to walk down a flight of stairs for a shower or the toilet and to be honest they were clean but could do with modernising. There is some storage space but not a lot however we were only there for just one night so didn't take a lot anyway. Our bed was really comfortable and we slept very well to wake up with a quite nice breakfast although a very small dining room, again not big enough for a 30 roomed hotel. I would stay here again but after a good renovation could be a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: London_girl09
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in the Cricklewood Lodge for a friend who was staying in London for a few days. I went to pick up the keys for him and was greeted by an incredibly rude man in the reception, which immediately set alarm bells ringing. As soon as I walked I could see the hotel was shabby, and had a dank, horrible atmosphere to it so I asked if I could see the room before paying. The receptionist wasn't too happy about this, and I can see why he didn't want me to see it. The room turned out to be disgustingly dirty, it was smelly, full of ugly, rickety furniture, the bed was really uncomfortable . How could I let my friend stay there? I went back to the reception to let the man know I didn't want the room. He was on the phone for ages and totally ignored me. So I left the key on the counter and walked out. Later on he called me with a torrent of verbal abuse. I had the right to cancel my reservation and I don't feel I should have been subjected to this. Please avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “awful time at the Cricklewood”
Reviews.Author: ClareLancs
Reviews.Content: Theres nothing good to say about this hotel. It is in desperate need of renovation (it looks nothing like the pictures on the website). Our room (8) was dirty and shabby. The furniture was a mix of rickety old tables and a dirty desk. The tv didnt work properly and there was no remote control. The over bed light was a rusty desk lamp screwed to the wall. The sink in the bedroom was dirty and rusty and covered in fag burns. Our double bed was awful due to the fact it was made up of 2 doors which nicely stuck out from under the mattress! Now for the best bit, the shower room. It was filthy. The toilet would not flush, the bowl was black, as was the floor. The shower was no better, it was covered in mould. You had to lift the whole door up to get it to close ( that is if you were brave enough to get in it ). The window also would not shut and to stop people looking in, it was covered with newspaper. Unfortunately the breakfast wasn`t any better. It was run by 3 girls who could not speak very good english, and they didn`t think twice about arguing in front of the guests. The food was very poor, i could only recommend the toast. Overall i can not give this hotel more than 1 out of 10. Please think carefully before booking a stay at the Cricklewood.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all cost”
Reviews.Author: Travel_guy58
Reviews.Content: We visited London for 3 days to see my son before moving on to Paris. He found this "little gem" for us and I guess being a backbacker, hostel, budget traveller he felt it was good value and it was definitely close to his flat. We found the family staff disinterested and had no sense of customer service whatsoever. The room we were given was in the basement...well if we had not not been exhausted from our very long day we would have walked right back out. It was grimey, dank and dark. The overall level of the hotel was poor to very poor. We stayed because we were barely in the room other than to sleep and we know it would be over soon. Finally, breakfast (included with the room) was just passable served with the same "I really don't care" level of service we had come to expect. We were supposed to stay on our last night before our flight home but instead stayed at The Crown Morin Hotel just up the street, what luxury!

HotelInfo.Name: Cricklewood Lodge Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Cricklewood Broadway | Cricklewood, London NW2 3JX, England
